<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CRYPTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/coinbase-goes-public-landmark-moment-crypto?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Master of $COIN
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/coinbase-goes-public-landmark-moment-crypto" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Coinbase going public" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzMzL2NvaW5iYXNlX2dvaW5nX3B1YmxpYy5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Coinbase, a cryptocurrency exchange, <a href="https://apnews.com/article/coinbase-stock-ipo-price-c3b802074ce4349b5bccf9ba43022800?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went public</a> on the Nasdaq, a stock exchange.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most of the coverage around the event included words like “historic,” “milestone,” and “<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/rocket_1f680.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/full-moon-symbol_1f315.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/full-moon-symbol_1f315.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/full-moon-symbol_1f315.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt="">.” Here’s why:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s the first major crypto company to go public in the US.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>With a valuation of around $86 billion when trading closed yesterday, it’s bigger</span><span><em> </em></span><span>than exchanges like the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq. </span>
</li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The success of Coinbase reflects the rise of cryptocurrency from the murkier regions of the internet to </span><span><em>potentially</em></span><span> an asset class that is adopted across traditional finance. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The Coinbasics</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The company was <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coinbase-ceo-to-take-crypto-exchange-public-after-bringing-bitcoin-to-masses-11618392602?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">founded</a> in 2012 by former Airbnb engineer Brian Armstrong (now Coinbase’s CEO) and former Goldman Sachs trader Fred Ehrsam. It allows you to buy and sell bitcoin, ethereum, and many other cryptocurrencies not named dogecoin. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As the price of bitcoin shot up, so did Coinbase’s fortunes. Just three years ago it was valued at $8 billion, but in the most recent quarter posted some <a href="https://www.axios.com/cryptocurrency-coinbase-wall-street-listing-e2d273a4-a4ae-4b7b-91c4-575946132d0c.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Big League stats</a>: $730–$800 million in net income on $1.8 billion in revenue, which 9x’d from a year earlier. It has 56 million users.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Bitcoin itself has gained about 820% over the last year.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Like bitcoin, Coinbase is in many ways nontraditional. It is a remote-first company with no formal headquarters and, at a time when more companies are speaking up in political debates, said it won’t be involved in “broader societal issues.” Even its public market debut was unconventional—it opted for a direct listing instead of an IPO, sidestepping intermediaries that typically offer a more stable first day of trading. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">So what's next?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Coinbase bulls argue that it’s positioned itself at the center of a blockchain-based model of finance that’s ruffling suits on Wall Street. Bears say a) future competition for crypto trades will be fierce and b) investing in Coinbase is risky because it may ride or die with the price of bitcoin...and while bitcoin is moonbound right now, remember when it plunged 75% in 2018? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Coinbase will look to transition more of its client base from freshman pledges to institutional investors.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">+ Go deeper: </strong>More companies are testing new approaches to going public, and it can get confusing. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/traditional-ipo-vs-spac-everything-need-know-taking-company-public?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out our guide</a> explaining the difference between SPACs, traditional IPOs, and direct listings.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
VOTING RIGHTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/hundreds-companies-ceos-sign-provoting-access-letter?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
CEOs to America: Mistreatment Managed
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="NYT ad" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzMxL255dF9hZC5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>New York Times</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York Times readers who didn’t immediately flip ahead to the crossword yesterday morning saw a two-page statement <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/hundreds-of-companies-band-together-on-voting-access-11618403134?mod=hp_lead_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed</a> by hundreds of companies and corporate bigwigs condemning “any discriminatory legislation” that makes it harder for people to vote.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>They didn’t mention it by name, but execs were subtweeting a new voting law enacted in Georgia and others like it circulating through statehouses across the country.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who signed: </strong>Amazon, BlackRock, Google, and Warren Buffett. Former American Express CEO Kenneth Chenault and Merck CEO Kenneth Frazier, two high-profile Black corporate leaders, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/31/business/voting-rights-georgia-corporations.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">spearheaded the effort</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who notably didn’t sign: </strong>Coca-Cola, Delta, or the influential JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon. They did, however, all put out <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/14/business/dealbook/ceos-voting-rights.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">their own statements</a> on the issue preceding the passage of Georgia’s controversial law. Walmart also declined to sign; its CEO Doug McMillon told employees, “We are not in the business of partisan politics.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>The developments "could possibly reshape political giving and potentially fracture a long-held alliance between the GOP and corporate business giants," <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/04/14/letter-voting-georgia-buffet-target-netflix-amazon/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the WaPo</a>.</p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
OBITUARY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/bernard-l-madoff-dies-82-prison-largest-ponzi-scheme-history?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Madoff, Mastermind Behind Largest Ponzi Scheme, Dies
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/bernard-l-madoff-dies-82-prison-largest-ponzi-scheme-history" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bernie Madoff leaving court" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzMwL2Jlcm5pZV9tYWRvZmYuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Hiroko Masuike/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Bernie Madoff, one of the most infamous investment bankers and the reason you know what a Ponzi scheme is, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/14/business/bernie-madoff-dead/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">died</a> in prison Wednesday at 82 from reported natural causes. Madoff orchestrated the biggest investment fraud in US history, costing his investors a total of $64.8 billion and earning him a 150-year prison sentence. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A quick timeline: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1960: </strong>At 22, Madoff started his investment company. From there he had a legendary career on Wall Street, and wealthy folks like Steven Spielberg and then-NY Mets owner Fred Wilpon trusted him with their cash.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">?: </strong>No one knows for certain when the fraud began, but at some point Madoff began to pay off old investors with new investors’ money, i.e., running a Ponzi scheme, and falsifying bank statements. That means he didn’t actually invest any of the cash his clients gave him. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">December 10, 2008:</strong> Madoff confessed to his sons, who turned him in immediately, and the next day the FBI raided his offices. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">March 12, 2009:</strong> Madoff pleaded guilty to 11 felony charges.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> While Madoff claimed he was the sole organizer, more than a dozen people, including his brother Peter Madoff, were convicted of federal crimes. Madoff’s Ponzi scheme forced <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-madoff-sec/madoff-scandal-prompts-dozens-of-sec-reforms-idUSTRE58S44L20090929?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sweeping reform</a> within the SEC.</p>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>

</a>
</td>
</tr>

</th>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY JOBSOHIO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Follow the Leaders...to Ohio
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.jobsohio.com/ohio-for-leaders-general-business/?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning-brew&utm_campaign=madwell-1h2021&utm_content=static-gen-biz" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="JobsOhio" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL3BsYWNlbWVudC9pbWFnZXMvMjIwOC8xNjE2MTAzNTY1LUpPX0ludGVyY2VwdF9Nb3JuaW5nYnJld18xNTAweDg1MF9UYWxlbnRXb3JrZm9yY2UuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We have a feeling quite a few of our readers won the coveted “Most Likely to Succeed and Wear Fancy Business Clothes” award in high school.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If that sounds familiar, then you need to hear this: <a href="https://www.jobsohio.com/ohio-for-leaders-general-business/?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning-brew&utm_campaign=madwell-1h2021&utm_content=static-gen-biz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Ohio, simply put, is for leaders</a>. And since someone with your steely eyed determination likes facts and fancy figures, here you go:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ohio is the 9th best state for business, according to Chief Executive Magazine </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ohio is home to two of the Top 25 Best Cities for Job Seekers: Cincinnati and Columbus</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Ohio’s venture capital growth was 134% between 2017 and 2019</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What we’re saying is, <a href="https://www.jobsohio.com/ohio-for-leaders-general-business/?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning-brew&utm_campaign=madwell-1h2021&utm_content=static-gen-biz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">they are doing WORK in Ohio</a>. And they want big-time work-doers like you to be part of the action.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So grab your “Most Likely To” trophy and your finest slacks, and <a href="https://www.jobsohio.com/ohio-for-leaders-general-business/?utm_medium=newsletter&utm_source=morning-brew&utm_campaign=madwell-1h2021&utm_content=static-gen-biz" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">head over to Ohio</a>.</p>

</tr>

</th>
</tr>

GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/key-performance-indicators-april-15?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">

Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/key-performance-indicators-april-15" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Bhutan vaccinations" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC80NzM1L2JodXRhbl92YWNjaW5hdGlvbnMucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Our World in Data</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat:</strong> Bhutan, a Himalayan kingdom sandwiched between India and China, vaccinated <a href="https://apnews.com/article/asia-pacific-coronavirus-pandemic-bhutan-dbfa7343aa3de02f4cb0cb9b6e4006f4?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">almost 93%</a> of its adult population in just 16 days. Granted, it has fewer people than Indianapolis, but it’s still an impressive feat that can be credited to its cold chain storage infrastructure and a network of volunteers.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Perhaps more interesting is that Bhutan received its first batch of vaccines in January, but waited to administer them on an “</span><span><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/2021/04/14/bhutan-vaccines/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">auspicious date</a></span><span>” determined by a panel of Buddhist monks. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“It is time to end America’s longest war.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Biden said yesterday that he’ll <a href="https://www.npr.org/2021/04/14/986955659/biden-to-announce-he-will-end-americas-longest-war-in-afghanistan?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">withdraw</a> all remaining US troops from Afghanistan by September 11, the 20-year anniversary of the 9/11 attacks.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read: </strong>The redemption of Justin Bieber. (<a href="https://www.gq.com/story/justin-bieber-cover-profile-may-2021?utm_source=nextdraft&utm_medium=email&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">GQ</a>)</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/04/14/american-airlines-expects-summer-travel-heat?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
It's Gonna Be a Stroopwafel Summer
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Snakes on a plane" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=285 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/5xtDartXnQbcW5CfM64/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Snakes on a plane" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/5xtDartXnQbcW5CfM64/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">American Airlines has had it with these empty seats on these empty planes, announcing yesterday that it expects summer travel to hit pre-pandemic levels. After first-quarter seating capacity in Q1 fell 43% compared to early 2019, American said it’ll <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/14/american-airlines-ramps-up-domestic-schedule-to-nearly-pre-pandemic-levels.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">soar back up</a> to 90% domestically and 80% internationally during the warmer months.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>To prepare, it's adding 150 new routes, both within the US and to international weekend destinations including Mexico and the Caribbean.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The entire industry is preparing for a </strong><strong style="color:#000"><em>Project X</em></strong><strong style="color:#000">-style summer</strong>.<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>Delta is reopening middle seats in May and United’s adding <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/american-airlines-plans-for-expanded-summer-flying-schedule-11618406200?mod=hp_lista_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">24 new routes</a> by Memorial Day.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">However...</strong>yesterday, the CDC stepped in to remind everyone there's still a pandemic going on. It released a study with Kansas State concluding that vacant middle seats on airplanes <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/airline-news/2021/04/14/covid-travel-cdc-study-says-empty-middle-seats-social-distancing-planes-reduce-exposure/7224517002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reduce the risk</a> of exposure to Covid-19. That's not likely to stop airlines from filling them given surging demand. </p>

<tr>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

BREW'S BETS

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Great pod: </strong>Hosted by LinkedIn cofounder and investor at Greylock, Reid Hoffman, <em>Masters of Scale</em> shows how companies grow from 0 to a gazillion. <a href="https://mastersofscale.com/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Listen and subscribe</a> to hear interviews with gazillionaires like Mark Zuckerberg and Bill Gates. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s time for Three Headlines and a Lie, where we give you four headlines and you try to decide which one, like your reason for not being able to attend all the rescheduled Covid weddings this summer, is made up:</p>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“The ‘Leave Britney Alone’ video was </span><span><a href="https://foundation.app/ChrisCrocker/leave-britney-alone-21947?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold</a></span><span> as an NFT for over $40,000”</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“France </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/article/paris-europe-coronavirus-pandemic-france-931e731b1d0485ef938a4911944cc5b6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigates</a></span><span><span> secret restaurants for Paris elite”</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“'World's biggest rabbit' </span><span><a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-england-hereford-worcester-56720118?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stolen</a></span><span><span> from owner's garden”</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Coinbase </span><span><a href="https://media1.giphy.com/media/iDUKerBP5SynTxBO2u/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e478qtopydyfp3soq6gjoa210t0o1k0ytw95jyexvc5&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">partners</a></span><span><span> with Pitbull to create ‘Direct Listing Anthem’”</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ol>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMost of the coverage around the event included words like “historic,” “milestone,” and “\u003cimg why:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s the first major crypto company to go public in the US.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWith a valuation of around $86 billion when trading closed yesterday, it’s bigger\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003e \u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003ethan exchanges like the New York Stock Exchange and Nasdaq. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe success of Coinbase reflects the rise of cryptocurrency from the murkier regions of the internet to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003epotentially\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e an asset class that is adopted across traditional finance. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe Coinbasics\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe company was \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coinbase-ceo-to-take-crypto-exchange-public-after-bringing-bitcoin-to-masses-11618392602?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efounded\u003c/a\u003e in 2012 by former Airbnb engineer Brian Armstrong (now Coinbase’s CEO) and former Goldman Sachs trader Fred Ehrsam. It allows you to buy and sell bitcoin, ethereum, and many other cryptocurrencies not named dogecoin. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs the price of bitcoin shot up, so did Coinbase’s fortunes. Just three years ago it was valued at $8 billion, but in the most recent quarter posted some \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/cryptocurrency-coinbase-wall-street-listing-e2d273a4-a4ae-4b7b-91c4-575946132d0c.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBig League stats\u003c/a\u003e: $730–$800 million in net income on $1.8 billion in revenue, which 9x’d from a year earlier. It has 56 million users.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBitcoin itself has gained about 820% over the last year.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLike bitcoin, Coinbase is in many ways nontraditional. It is a remote-first company with no formal headquarters and, at a time when more companies are speaking up in political debates, said it won’t be involved in “broader societal issues.” Even its public market debut was unconventional—it opted for a direct listing instead of an IPO, sidestepping intermediaries that typically offer a more stable first day of trading. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eSo what's next?\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCoinbase bulls argue that it’s positioned itself at the center of a blockchain-based model of finance that’s ruffling suits on Wall Street. Bears say a) future competition for crypto trades will be fierce and b) investing in Coinbase is risky because it may ride or die with the price of bitcoin...and while bitcoin is moonbound right now, remember when it plunged 75% in 2018? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eCoinbase will look to transition more of its client base from freshman pledges to institutional investors.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew York Times readers who didn’t immediately flip ahead to the crossword yesterday morning saw a two-page statement \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/hundreds-of-companies-band-together-on-voting-access-11618403134?mod=hp_lead_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigned\u003c/a\u003e by hundreds of companies and corporate bigwigs condemning “any discriminatory legislation” that makes it harder for people to vote.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThey didn’t mention it by name, but execs were subtweeting a new voting law enacted in Georgia and others like it circulating through statehouses across the country.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho signed: \u003c/strong\u003eAmazon, BlackRock, Google, and Warren Buffett. Former American Express CEO Kenneth Chenault and Merck CEO Kenneth Frazier, two high-profile Black corporate leaders, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/03/31/business/voting-rights-georgia-corporations.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003espearheaded the effort\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho notably didn’t sign: \u003c/strong\u003eCoca-Cola, Delta, or the influential JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon. They did, however, all put out \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/04/14/business/dealbook/ceos-voting-rights.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etheir own statements\u003c/a\u003e on the issue preceding the passage of Georgia’s controversial law. Walmart also declined to sign; its CEO Doug McMillon told employees, “We are not in the business of partisan politics.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eThe developments \"could possibly reshape political giving and potentially fracture a long-held alliance between the GOP and corporate business giants,\" \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2021/04/14/letter-voting-georgia-buffet-target-netflix-amazon/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eper the WaPo\u003c/a\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBernie Madoff, one of the most infamous investment bankers and the reason you know what a Ponzi scheme is, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/04/14/business/bernie-madoff-dead/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edied\u003c/a\u003e in prison Wednesday at 82 from reported natural causes. Madoff orchestrated the biggest investment fraud in US history, costing his investors a total of $64.8 billion and earning him a 150-year prison sentence. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA quick timeline: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1960: \u003c/strong\u003eAt 22, Madoff started his investment company. From there he had a legendary career on Wall Street, and wealthy folks like Steven Spielberg and then-NY Mets owner Fred Wilpon trusted him with their cash.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e?: \u003c/strong\u003eNo one knows for certain when the fraud began, but at some point Madoff began to pay off old investors with new investors’ money, i.e., running a Ponzi scheme, and falsifying bank statements. That means he didn’t actually invest any of the cash his clients gave him. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDecember 10, 2008:\u003c/strong\u003e Madoff confessed to his sons, who turned him in immediately, and the next day the FBI raided his offices. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eMarch 12, 2009:\u003c/strong\u003e Madoff pleaded guilty to 11 felony charges.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e While Madoff claimed he was the sole organizer, more than a dozen people, including his brother Peter Madoff, were convicted of federal crimes. Madoff’s Ponzi scheme forced \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-madoff-sec/madoff-scandal-prompts-dozens-of-sec-reforms-idUSTRE58S44L20090929?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esweeping reform\u003c/a\u003e within the SEC.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmerican Airlines has had it with these empty seats on these empty planes, announcing yesterday that it expects summer travel to hit pre-pandemic levels. After first-quarter seating capacity in Q1 fell 43% compared to early 2019, American said it’ll \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/04/14/american-airlines-ramps-up-domestic-schedule-to-nearly-pre-pandemic-levels.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esoar back up\u003c/a\u003e to 90% domestically and 80% internationally during the warmer months.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTo prepare, it's adding 150 new routes, both within the US and to international weekend destinations including Mexico and the Caribbean.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe entire industry is preparing for a \u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eProject X\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/strong\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e-style summer\u003c/strong\u003e.\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003eDelta is reopening middle seats in May and United’s adding \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/american-airlines-plans-for-expanded-summer-flying-schedule-11618406200?mod=hp_lista_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e24 new routes\u003c/a\u003e by Memorial Day.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHowever...\u003c/strong\u003eyesterday, the CDC stepped in to remind everyone there's still a pandemic going on. It released a study with Kansas State concluding that vacant middle seats on airplanes \u003ca href=\"https://www.usatoday.com/story/travel/airline-news/2021/04/14/covid-travel-cdc-study-says-empty-middle-seats-social-distancing-planes-reduce-exposure/7224517002/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereduce the risk\u003c/a\u003e of exposure to Covid-19.
